attributes.action: compel Manchester Metropolitan University to review its Crewe campus parking regulations.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This academic year, MMU has made major changes to car parking regulations for student and staff.

Primary excuses include environment and income generation. The changes applied to MMU cheshire campus, which has poor public transport links and a lot of students and staff traveling considerable distances.

The few staff 'lucky' enough to get a parking permit also now have to pay and display!!!!!

The University needs to rectify the situation immediately as at present the situation is becoming untenable for residents and students alike as people are forced to park on residential roads, upsetting residents.

MMU Cheshire needs a unique campus based parking policy to take into account its location and the fact transport is poor. Using the Manchester campus policies bodged for Chesire is NOT acceptable!!

The policy needs to be changed so that those who need to travel by car can park on campus. The university needs to understand that in many cases, banning cars increases costs for students to travel, wastes valuable personal study time and the fact many students have other commitments that cant wait for 3 buses to come at once an hour late!!!

rejection.details: Please contact the Manchester Metropolitan University.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
